you have nvidia-glx installed?
yes
via Envy
it is really easy to install the nvidia official driver

you have to disable the nv module

I'll do a quick search. I'm using debian now and It is different
thanks
go to /etc/ and see if you've got a "restricted-modules" file
I do not appear to.
do sudo gedit /etc/default/linux-restricted-modules-common
under diable modules, you disable nvidia
sorry sorry,write nv and now nvidia
so it should say DISABLED_MODULES="nv" ?
that'll disable the nvidia module from the restricted modules file and there'll be no version missmatch
precisely
thanks! I'll try it.
don't forget you must unnistall the nvida glx package too
and you also need "apt-get install linux-headers-`uname -r` build-essential gcc gcc-3.4 xserver-xorg-dev" so that nvidia works properly
